head.supplied: Melbourne botanic & zoologic Garden ¶ 25 March 61. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the insertion of the following advertisement during the month of April i...

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: Fn 1 makes no sense: there was not a Gazette published on that date!

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: I realized after chasing it up that this is a reference to a transcription, here as 61-03-25a, so have extended the note.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: BUT surely the M Bibliography entry cited in the entry for the Notice should have an April date, not March. If the Bnumber is changed, then insert that instead of the reference given in full here.
S61/2326, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the insertion of the following advertisement during the month of April in the Government Gazette.
See Notice, 25 March 1861, in this edition as 61-03-25a. It appeared in Victoria - Government Gazette , No 52, April 3 1861, p 682.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary.
The Argus drew the public's attention to the above notice on 10 April 1861, p. 5, col. a.
